replies.bodyText:
Hello @fostersdesign,
I don't see any style classes called .sak-banner-warn or .sak-banner-error anywhere in Samigo or Sakai.  Or did you mean I should create them?
However, there is at least one other place in Samigo that uses alertMessage.  I don't see why it can't be used?
But... there is another style in samigo called messageSamigo2, that looks similar to an alert.  Should I use that style?  (however, I feel that alertMessage looks nicer than messageSamigo2)
replies.author: austin48

replies.bodyText: These new banner classes were added to the SASS files in SAK-41866 / #6966 for Sakai 20. We're trying to move away from the various other message classes to use these standard new ones as a part of the SWITCH standardization project.
replies.author: fostersdesign

replies.bodyText:
sorry about that, I must have done a bad search when I tried to search the code from master.  I'll use .sak-banner-error.
although, it would be nice if this patch could be merged to 19.x... but 19.x doesn't have the patch from SAK-41866 / #6966.  if / when it gets merged to 19.x, would it be ok to use alertMessage then?
replies.author: austin48

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I'm not familiar with how we handle different implementations for different versions (e.g. previous version). Maybe @ern or @bjones86 or @ottenhoff might be able to provide some recommendations.
replies.author: fostersdesign

replies.bodyText:
If it depends on things that don't exist in 19.x, they typically won't be merged back to that version.
Alternatively, you could submit a follow up PR against 19.x with the necessary changes, after this has been merged to master, or you could backport to your local fork and make the changes there (obviously not as ideal).
replies.author: bjones86

replies.bodyText: I would suggest a custom PR for 19.x explaining why the normal merge process can't be used
replies.author: ottenhoff

replies.bodyText:
I'll backport to my local 19.x fork for now.
Also, I've committed the latest changes you guys requested.
replies.author: austin48
